main event: A saucer-shaped object, the size of a grapefruit, was observed for 25 seconds at Etain Air Base, France on July 11, 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared to be traveling straight and level, blinking off to the north and never coming on again.
The sighting was confirmed as being Sputnik III.
There were four military observers who reported seeing the round, white object for about a minute.
Calculations were made to determine the object's possible relation to the orbits of Sputnik III and 1958 Alpha 2 (the rocket portion of Sputnik III).
Another sighting was reported on July 12, 1958 near Greenway, Wisconsin, which was determined to likely be a Sputnik III rocket and satellite.
result: Probable Sputnik III and related objects
sighted object: saucer-shaped object, round and white object
location: Etain AFB, France; Near Greenway, Wisconsin
